text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Thursday:
- Swiss unions want to launch a people's initiative to reduce working hours to 37 per week without wage cuts.
- Swiss Telecom PTT will cut domestic phone call rates on August 1.
- Swiss police recovered emptied mail bags stolen in an Intercity train robbery in Lausanne in December.
- Swissair, in conjunction with partners Austrian Airlines, Delta Air and Sabena, is slashing its fares to some 200 U.S. cities from now until mid-March.

- Elektrizitaets-Gesellschaft Laufenburg (EGL) expects results for the current year ending in September to be similar to last year's. EGL's group profit rose by 24.6 percent to 40.9 million Swiss francs in the 1995/96 fiscal year.
- Germany's Cartel commission approved Von Roll Group's planned takeover of the Voith metal casting factory in Heidenheim.
- Leading Swiss retailer Coop's sales rose by 3.1 percent to 8.8 billion Swiss francs in 1996.
